name: meshping
description: MeshPing is a peer-to-peer networking monitoring tool that detects connectivity issues across mesh nodes. Itâ€™s suitable for monitoring decentralized or distributed networks in self-hosted environments.
features: Mesh monitoring: Track connectivity between all nodes in a mesh network topology.
Latency measurement: Monitor ping times and latency between mesh nodes in real-time.
Connectivity visualization: View network topology and connection status in graphical format.
Outage detection: Automatically identify when nodes become unreachable or connections fail.
Historical data: Track network performance over time with historical latency and uptime data.
Alert system: Configure notifications for connectivity issues or performance degradation.
Multi-node support: Monitor networks with dozens or hundreds of interconnected nodes.
Peer-to-peer testing: Each node pings others to create a complete connectivity matrix.
Dashboard view: See overall network health and identify problem areas at a glance.
Export functionality: Download network performance data for analysis or reporting.
Lightweight agents: Minimal resource usage on monitored nodes for efficient operation.
Decentralized architecture: Suitable for monitoring distributed or mesh network deployments.
